author: Kate Corliss
title: Washingtonians Could Maybe Kind Of See the Northern Lights Again Tonight
text: The DC area felt a whole lot like the Westfjords on Thursday night, as the vibrant colors of aurora borealis streaked across skies in the District, Maryland, and Northern Virginia. Perhaps you missed last night‚Äôs space weather spectacular, or maybe the display was so awe-inspiring that you just have to see it again. Will tonight bring the possibility of another glimpse at the Northern Lights? [Elizabeth MacDonald](https://science.nasa.gov/people/elizabeth-macdonald/), a space physicist at NASA‚Äôs Goddard Space Flight Center who specializes in studying auroras, doesn‚Äôt want to get your hopes up. ‚ÄúI really do think it‚Äôs best to temper expectations, even though I hate to be the bearer of that news,‚Äù she tells Washingtonian, who called her, dazzled by last night‚Äôs spectacle, in the hopes that she would tell us the Northern Lights will be visible from the DMV again, tonight and every night forever. A few of my favorite Northern Lights photos from Washington DC tonight. They are still active but have dimmed a little. [#northernlights][#AuroraBorealis][#Aurora][pic.twitter.com/RtobPZ44MW]‚Äî Jonah Bryson (@JonahLBryson) [October 11, 2024] But while the chances for a showing like yesterday‚Äôs are slim, MacDonald says there is some possibility for some auroral action on a smaller scale. ‚ÄúThe chance is higher than usual because it was seen last night and because we‚Äôre in the recovery of this large storm,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúBut the chance is nowhere near as likely as it would be‚Äù on a night like Thursday. But if those relatively elevated odds are enough for you‚Äîand you‚Äôre willing to dedicate your Friday night to the galaxy‚Äîhere‚Äôs what you should do: Get out of the city Light pollution in DC and its immediate suburbs will likely make it difficult to see any Northern Lights activity from your apartment‚Äôs balcony. Last night was the ‚Äúmain event‚Äù of the geomagnetic storm that sparked what we saw yesterday, according to MacDonald‚Äîthat‚Äôs because the storm was just beginning, and she says that‚Äôs ‚Äúwhere you see the aurora down as far south as we saw it last night.‚Äù Northern lights over Maryland tonight ü§©‚ú®üåÑ no filter. [pic.twitter.com/c5nbJem7zy]‚Äî Dara T. Mathis (@TrulyTafakari) [October 10, 2024] That storm is now starting to subside, which means so is the probability that we‚Äôll see the lights tonight as vividly as we did Thursday. Still, MacDonald says, ‚ÄúThere could still be some aurora seen maybe outside of DC or maybe in the darker areas.‚Äù There‚Äôs no way to predict exactly where the best local viewing spot is, but MacDonald recommends the [National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration‚Äôs Aurora 30 Minute Forecast](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/products/aurora-30-minute-forecast) as a tool to help identify the likelihood of visibility in a given area. [Light pollution maps](https://www.lightpollutionmap.info/#zoom=4.00&lat=45.8720&lon=14.5470&state=eyJiYXNlbWFwIjoiTGF5ZXJCaW5nUm9hZCIsIm92ZXJsYXkiOiJ3YV8yMDE1Iiwib3ZlcmxheWNvbG9yIjpmYWxzZSwib3ZlcmxheW9wYWNpdHkiOjYwLCJmZWF0dXJlc29wYWNpdHkiOjg1fQ==) are another resource to consult. Clear your schedule Last night, the Northern Lights were visible to the naked eye just about [as soon as the sun went down](https://x.com/capitalweather/status/1844519269582954732). Since the solar storm is dying down, such an early appearance is not as likely. ‚ÄúMost of the time, when you‚Äôre going to be able to see aurora is mostly around midnight, because around midnight is when your location on Earth is going to rotate kind of closest to where the aurora is‚Äîwhich is generally an oval shape, a ring shape, around the Pole,‚Äù MacDonald says. Northern lights in Northern Virginia! Incredible sight [#ShotOniPhone][pic.twitter.com/HtAXR4XUqI]‚Äî Rohan Tandon (@lucidstarfield) [October 11, 2024] So your odds of seeing aurora ‚Äúwould probably maximize around midnight.‚Äù But, according to MacDonald, space weather experts did notice some red lights last night, which could be a promising sign. ‚ÄúThat can be an unusual kind of ring called the SAR arc that is seen further south than the usual aurora,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúThere is some chance that that continues, and so there‚Äôs some chance that there‚Äôs a weak red visible, and that could be visible earlier in the night potentially.‚Äù Pack a camera If you do decide to gamble on chasing the Northern Lights tonight, MacDonald advises that you bring some sort of camera along‚Äîand a smartphone will work just fine. ‚ÄúCameras are better sensors than our eyes to color at night, so there is some chance that it could be visible just on the camera,‚Äù she says. Northern lights putting on a show tonight! I can even see them flying over DC [pic.twitter.com/s820ybKeCg]‚Äî Meteorologist Grant Coleman (@whsvcolefront) [October 11, 2024]
